items.title: Biden Warns of a ‘Very, Very Dark Moment’ as He Hits Out at Trump
items.summary: The former president, now a far less popular figure in his party, appeared in Nebraska for an overtly political speech that slammed his successor.

items.title: Airport Disruptions Limited as Shutdown Flight Cuts Begin
items.summary: About 3 percent of Friday’s flights were canceled because of the government shutdown. The percentage could rise to 20 percent as the holidays approach.

items.title: A Light in Very Dark Days: Nancy Pelosi and AIDS
items.summary: As Ms. Pelosi announced her retirement, she was celebrated for her long tenure in Washington. But back home, she was remembered for showing up at a terrifying moment when others turned away.

items.title: Judge Blocks National Guard From Portland and Says Trump Overstepped His Authority
items.summary: With her temporary block expiring, Judge Karin Immergut said the Trump administration had failed to prove that protesters were hampering President Trump’s policies.

items.title: Federal Judge Rules Against Trump Officials on Partisan Email Messages
items.summary: The email accounts of furloughed government workers had been commandeered to send partisan attacks against Democrats, a move that the ruling said had “added insult to injury.”

items.title: A Democrat Pushing 80 Confronts the Young(er) and Restless
items.summary: A fight brewing in Massachusetts could preview Democrats’ age battles.

items.title: Trump-Orbán meeting: US gives Hungary exemption from sanctions on Russian oil and gas
items.summary: <p>US president also praises Hungarian leader’s hardline stance on immigration during friendly White House summit</p><p>The US has granted Hungary a one-year exemption from US sanctions on importing oil and gas from Russia, according to a White House official, after Viktor Orbán pressed his case for a reprieve during a meeting with <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> in Washington.</p><p>Last month, Trump imposed <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/us-announces-sanctions-russian-oil-companies-rosneft-lukoil-2025-10-22/">Ukraine-related sanctions</a> on Russian oil companies Lukoil and Rosneft that carried the threat of further sanctions on entities in countries buying oil from them.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/07/trump-orban-hungary-russian-oil">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Federal judge issues permanent ban on deployment of national guard troops in Portland – as it happened
items.summary: <p>This live blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/07/trump-administration-news-updates-today">Trump news at a glance: supreme court blocks full Snap food aid payments following White House request</a></p></li></ul><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/profile/roth-andrew">Andrew Roth</a><em> in Washington and </em><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/profile/flora-garamvolgyi">Flora Garamvolgyi</a><em> in Budapest</em></p><p><strong>Viktor Orbán</strong> will visit the White House today as Hungary’s far-right prime minister <strong>tries to broker another summit between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin</strong> that Orbán’s advisers claim could help end the war between Russia and Ukraine.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/07/donald-trump-government-shutdown-air-traffic-flights-snap-viktor-orban-hungary-ukraine-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>
